item.title: Vampire The Masquerade Bloodlines 2 Beginner's Guide
item.description:
Vampire - The Masquerade: Bloodlines 2 is an action RPG that puts players into the shoes of Phyre, a vampire who existed before the game's story. Players will hunt and prowl around the city of Seattle, which can present challenges of its own, even if you're a legendary vampire with cool abilities. This guide will share some of the best tips and tricks for players that will help with various in-game mechanics and make the overall experience a lot more fun.

Use Rooftops to Travel Faster

Players can sprint at inhumane speeds in Vampire The Masquerade Bloodlines 2 , covering long distances within mere seconds. This is a welcome mechanic considering the game does not feature a fast-travel system. While it's a core gameplay mechanic, players cannot just whiz past the streets, exposing their exceptional abilities to the bystanders. So, players will need to rely on rooftops if they want to run at full speed and travel to a far-off location.

Thankfully, it is the most fun way to travel around the city of Seattle. You can use the vampiric sense to detect pipes, emergency staircases, ventilation shafts, and other objects that Phyre can use to reach atop a building. From there, combine the dash, sprint, and hover abilities to cover great distances in a single leap. This is the only way to quickly move around the city undetected.

You Can Use Stealth in Combat Encounters

Due to Phyre's remarkable strength, they can send enemies flying across the room in a single punch. However, for people who're playing on higher difficulties or just love approaching missions stealthily, Bloodlines 2 has just the mechanic for them. When approaching an area with multiple enemies, be sure to crouch down and move around to reduce the enemy detection rate significantly.

To take things a step further, players can invest points in the Shadow Cloak skill if they pick the "Lasombra" class. After acquiring the skill, approach enemies stealthily, feed on them instead of attacking, and Phyre's body will be covered in a dark aura, concealing their presence even further.

Feed on People With Resonant Blood to Unlock Skills

Unlocking skills from another clan's skill tree does not only rely on skill points, but also requires a specific amount of Resonant Blood to unlock. There are three special types of blood in Vampire The Masquerade Bloodlines 2 that players will need to feed on to unlock skills.

Use Phyre's Heightened Sense to detect humans that have a specific glow to them. The color of the glow will help you determine which human carries a specific Resonant/Dormant blood type.

Blood Symbol

Blood Type

How to Feed

Sanguine Blood

Humans who glow pink should be flirted with before feeding on them.

Choleric Blood

Humans who glow red should be angered or antagonized before feeding on them.

Melancholic Blood

Humans who glow purple should be intimidated or insulted before feeding on them.

Complete Side Quests First

After completing the first few missions, players will come to a point where they'll need to choose whether to hand over Benny to Katsumi or Ryong in Vampire The Masquerade Bloodlines 2 . Once you've finally made your choice, side quests will become available on the map , alongside the next main mission.

While players can just focus on main missions, completing side missions is important considering how they'll vanish after particular story events, making them highly missable in your playthrough .

Pay Attention to The Cursor

There are many collectibles and lore devices hidden around various areas in Bloodlines 2 that players will need to find for specific achievements and trophies. The game aids players in this hunt for collectibles through the cursor, which gradually expands as players get close to a hidden collectible. Once the cursor turns red , you'll find yourself in front of the collectible.

It's a unique and quite helpful mechanic that takes the frustration out of finding all the collectibles in an area.

7 /10

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2

item.title: Upcoming RPGs That Let You Build Parties
item.description:
Dragon Quest is a legendary franchise that established a lot of modern JRPG tropes, from questing to leveling up. However, it took three games before it allowed players to build a party of their own, along with letting them switch classes, called Vocations, before battle. Now, the party makeup is one of the best things about JRPGs and RPGs .

It’s fun anticipating who could join the party next and what they will bring to the table, from their unique skills to their personalitites. Will they be magically gifted, super strong, or have a knack for healing? Anyone who loves a good party system in an RPG or JRPG should keep an eye out for these upcoming games.

Tales Of Xillia Remastered

Back In Action

Tales of Xillia Remastered
JRPG
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
October 31, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen / Blood, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : 10/31/25
  • Planned Systems : PC, PS5, Switch, and Xbox Series X/S

Tales of Xillia was released as a PS3 exclusive in 2013 in North America, and it’s one of the better entries in the Tales of series. Thankfully, now more players can experience it with the upcoming remaster. If this remaster is as good as the original version and has no bugs at launch, it’s safe to say it will be one of the better introductory titles in the series.

Players can explore big open areas connected by pathways filled with roaming monsters. Combat is action-based, with parties consisting of four characters, all of which can link attacks depending on character dynamics.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road

Goooooal!

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road
Sports
RPG
Action
Systems
Released
November 13, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : 11/13/25
  • Planned Systems : PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Switch 2, and Xbox Series X/S

Inazuma Eleven is a long-running soccer RPG franchise from Level-5. Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is the biggest entry in years, and it features a combination of real-time and tactical gameplay. Players can attend school and make friends, but the most alluring feature is the soccer matches.

During soccer matches, players can move characters around like a normal sports game, but things slow down when accessing special moves. Choosing who should be on the team is a big part of the party system, akin to more mainstream games like choosing Blitzball teammates in Final Fantasy 10 .

Octopath Traveler 0

The Biggest Party To Date

Octopath Traveler 0
JRPG
Adventure
Fantasy
Systems
Released
December 4, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Fantasy Violence, Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : 12/4/25
  • Planned Systems : PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Switch 2, and Xbox Series X/S

Octopath Traveler 0 is one of the more exciting upcoming turn-based RPGs because it features large parties. Players can create parties of up to eight characters in battle, switching between two rows of four on the fly. That’s more than previous games in the series, but there are other reasons why Octopath Traveler 0 looks interesting.

There’s also a town building mechanic in the game, which is a new feature for the series. Even though it’s based on a mobile game, this updated expansion looks like the most ambitious entry yet, and it will hit a plethora of platforms at launch.

Fire Emblem: Fortune’s Weave

To The Coliseum

Fire Emblem: Fortune's Weave
RPG
Tactical
Systems
Released
2026
Developer(s)
Intelligent Systems
Publisher(s)
Nintendo

Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : 2026
  • Planned Systems : Switch 2

The upcoming Fire Emblem: Fortune’s Weave is the latest game in the series, which looks to be shaking things up ever so slightly. The Fire Emblem series is known for letting players create diverse parties of class-based characters ranging from bulky knights to glass cannon mages.

The only trailer shown so far for Fire Emblem: Fortune’s Weave only shows four playable characters, and they all fight their battles solo. While the setting is new—seemingly based on Greek and Roman practices—it probably won’t diverge that far gameplay-wise from past entries; that is to say, it will assuredly have a party system to go with its tactical gameplay.

Sea Of Remnants

Avast Ye RPG Lovers

Sea of Remnants
Strategy
Adventure
RPG
Systems
Released
2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : 2026
  • Planned Systems : PC and PS5

Sea of Remnants is an upcoming RPG that looks expansive and diverse in its gameplay offerings. Players can find characters to form their party with, but how the turn-based battles play out hasn’t been clearly defined yet.

There will also be sailing in the game, as the theme overall is based on pirating adventures. The real standout is the design, which looks unlike anything else out there. The timing and platforms haven’t been fully set, either, but it will be free to play, and it looks like it will at least launch on PC and PS5.

Persona 4 Revival

Bringing Back An Old Friend

Persona 4 Revival
JRPG
Simulation
Adventure
Systems
Developer(s)
Atlus

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : TBA
  • Planned Systems : PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X

Persona 3 Reload did well enough for Atlus that they are going to follow it up with another remake: Persona 4 Revival . Unfortunately, there’s not much known about the game right now other than what has been shown in the debut trailer. There were some environments on display, like towns and classrooms, along with a glimpse of what Yu looks like in the remake, but that’s it.

While the remake’s details aren’t known yet, including the release date, fans of the original game at least know it will have a party system that's based around turn-based combat. Collecting Personas, gathering allies through social groups, fighting monsters to level up, and so on will all certainly be included. Whenever it does come out, Persona fans will be there on day one.

Threads Of Time

Chrono Trigger Revival

Threads of Time
RPG
Systems
ESRB
T For Teen // Violence

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by
  • Planned Release Date : TBA
  • Planned Systems : PC and Xbox Series X

Square Enix fans have been begging the publisher to re-release Chrono Trigger in some form for years, be it a remaster, a straight port, or a remake. While the original game hasn’t seen a new release in years, indie developers have been trying to spiritually remake it. Sea of Stars is a premiere example, and it seems like the next big homage will come whenever Threads of Time releases, which looks more on the nose than Sea of Stars .

There is time travel between the present, the prehistoric past, and the future. There’s a world map and a diverse cast of characters, from warriors to mages, all listed on developer Riyo Games' website. The launch platforms are a bit of a mystery, but right now, this turn-based RPG can be pre-ordered on Steam and Xbox Marketplace, so those are two good indications for now.

item.title: Roblox: Adopt Me! Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • Adopt Me! Codes
  • How To Redeem Codes In Adopt Me!
  • How to Play Adopt Me!
  • The Best Roblox Town and City Games Like Adopt Me!
  • About the Adopt Me! Developers

If Roblox players enjoy caring for and raising pets and children, as well as customizing their character, then they'll almost certainly love Adopt Me! The purpose of this article is to provide players will all of the latest Adopt Me! codes. Redeeming them will give players a good boost, especially in the early stages of the game.

Updated October 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are currently no active codes available for Adopt Me! right now. However, new rewards are often added during special updates or events. Keep an eye on official announcements and revisit this page later to see when fresh codes become available.

Listed below are all the active and expired codes for Adopt Me!, as well as how to redeem them. At the time of writing, however, there are no active codes for Adopt Me!, and there's no way to redeem codes at the moment.

Adopt Me! Codes

Codes Checked on October 18, 2025.

All Active Adopt Me! Codes

  • No active codes.

All Expired Adopt Me! Codes

  • 40BILLION : 2x Multiplier
  • AMTRUCK2024 : Canine Cruiser
  • 2xROSS : 4hrs of 2x Bucks & Aging
  • SUMMERBREAK : 70 Bucks
  • SUMMERSALE : 70 Bucks
  • 1B1LL1ONV1S1TS : 200 Bucks
  • M0N3YTR33S : 200 Bucks
  • GIFTUNWRAP : 200 Bucks
  • DiscordFTW : 70 Bucks
  • subbethink : 100 Bucks
  • GIFTUNWRAP : 200 Bucks
  • SEAcreatures : unknown item

How To Redeem Codes In Adopt Me!

When it comes to redeeming codes in Adopt Me!, there are a few simple steps to follow that will be listed below. If, for some reason, a code does not work, be sure to check to see if the code has been entered correctly. If the code still doesn't work, it means that it has recently expired or has already been redeemed.

  1. Launch Adopt Me!
  2. Once you are in the game world, you need to exit the area of houses.
  3. Then go to the Trade Tower. To make it easier for you to find it, we have attached a screenshot above.
  4. Go inside and head towards Agent Ruhi.
  5. There will be a building right next to him. Go to it and press E.
  6. Copy a code into the code box and press enter

With the holiday season in full effect and the new year festivities around the corner, players should be sure to continue looking out for the latest news and updates regarding Adopt Me!

How to Play Adopt Me!

It is impossible to say precisely how to play Adopt Me! as it is an open world Role Play game. In other words, it's a life simulator where players can grow a child, take care of a pet, have fun in a big city, dress up their character, and just do whatever they want.

The Best Roblox Town and City Games Like Adopt Me!

Adopt Me! is a fun game, but it can get boring after a while. Players may also want to try something new. In this article below, players can find the top 5 games like Adopt Me!. All of them impress with their quality and provide a great gaming experience.

  • Berry Avenue
  • Brookhaven
  • Jailbreak
  • Ohio
  • Da Hood

About the Adopt Me! Developers

Adopt Me! is an exciting game created by Uplift Games. Their Roblox group already has more than 10M members, which is really impressive.

Roblox - Game
13
8.4 /10
Released
September 1, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Roblox Corporation
Publisher(s)
Roblox Corporation
Platform(s)
PC, iOS, Android, Xbox One, PS4
Powered by

item.title: 8 Games With The Most Satisfying Combat
item.description:
Action video games live and die by their combat. Not only are they supposed to be fun, fast-paced, and accessible, but they also need to make the player feel as good as possible. This is true of any game with a dedicated combat system, regardless of the genre they belong to (FPS, Musou, hack-and-slash, etc.)

Numerous developers have succeeded in this regard, crafting some of the most satisfying combat systems in the history of this medium. With their deep mechanics, fluid control schemes, epic bosses, and diverse assortments of weapons and abilities, the following games are perfect for anybody who wants great-feeling combat.

"Satisfying" does not have to mean complex combat.

Kingdom Hearts 2

Much More Than A Whimsical Disney Crossover

Kingdom Hearts 2
Action RPG
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
March 28, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Mild Blood, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

The Kingdom Hearts series is well-known for being a weird but magical crossover between Disney and Final Fantasy characters. However, that’s not the only reason these games have achieved so much success. Their real-time action RPG gameplay also contributed to their worldwide popularity, and Kingdom Hearts 2 has the best combat system in the entire franchise.

Sora moves rapidly in this sequel, especially compared to his movement in the original Kingdom Hearts. Each hit of his Keyblade feels so good to land on enemies that it’s impossible not to keep playing for hours and hours. Reaction Commands keep the combat in Kingdom Hearts 2 interesting and engaging, especially during boss fights. Hidden mechanics like knock back and revenge values add much-needed complexity, which has led to the creation of a passionate speed running community.

No More Heroes 2: Desperate Struggle

Wield Two Beam Katanas With Motion Controls

No More Heroes 2: Desperate Struggle
7.0 /10
Released
March 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

The No More Heroes series stands out in the Nintendo Wii’s gallery not only because of its excessive violence, but because of its unique combat system that allowed players to eliminate enemies with the console's motion controls. The original game was already great, but the sequel, No More Heroes 2: Desperate Struggle , was even better, at least in terms of raw action.

In No More Heroes 2 , Travis Touchdown can wield two Beam Katanas at the same time, and the player can execute bloody and explosive finishers by swinging both the Wii Remote and the Nunchuk in various directions. This can feel a tad weird at first, but it ends up being incredibly satisfying. Combined with Travis’ elaborate new wrestling moves, it results in an unforgettable action experience like no other.

God Of War 3

Kratos’ Original Trilogy Ended On A High Note

God of War III
8 /10
14
9.0 /10
Released
March 16, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

While the new God of War duology is superior to the Greek Mythology trilogy in terms of storytelling, graphics, and mechanics, there’s one aspect in which they still haven’t surpassed it: the combat. All three original God of War games boasted excellent combat systems but, naturally, God of War 3 has the absolute best one in the franchise. It felt like the culmination of everything Santa Monica Studio had learned while working on the first two PS2 games.

Kratos is more furious than ever in God of War 3 , which is reflected in his raw, violent, fierce fighting style. Swinging around the Blades of Chaos always felt great, but Kratos’ new collection of weapons (like the Claws of Hades and the Nemean Cestus) add some fun variety to the overall experience. Killing giant monsters and powerful corrupt deities with Quick-Time Events is as gruesome as it is satisfying. The advanced hardware of the PS3 allowed the developers to make all the blood and guts look shockingly realistic.

Bayonetta 2

An Over-The-Top Adventure, Starring A Stylish Witch

Bayonetta 2
8 /10
Released
October 24, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

PlatinumGames specializes in some of the most hectic and refined character action games on the market. While they have been responsible for multiple critical and commercial (like Metal Gear Rising and NieR: Automata ), Bayonetta 2 still possesses the best combat system this studio has ever designed. The original Bayonetta also had enjoyable hack-and-slash gameplay, but the sequel was better in every way.

The action itself is snappy, fluid, and fast-paced. Bayonetta herself is a fun character to watch mow down hordes of angels, and she has a huge collection of inventive weapons and useful abilities at her disposal. But the cherry on top of this excellent combat system is Witch Time, which allows the titular character to temporarily slow down time whenever the player avoids an attack at the last second. Mastering this mechanic may take some getting used to, but doing so is satisfying and takes the gameplay of Bayonetta 2 to a whole new level.

DOOM

Killing Demons In The First Person Always Feels Amazing

DOOM
8 /10
8.5 /10
Released
May 13, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

After a twelve-year-old hiatus, the iconic Doom franchise came back swinging in 2016, with the release of a high-quality modern reboot simply titled DOOM . This game was designed with one clear goal in mind: to allow players to rip and tear through as many horrible demons as possible and make them feel good while doing so. Needless to say, the talented developers at id Software knocked it out of the park.

From the moment the Doom Slayer rips apart a monitor at the beginning of the campaign and starts mowing down hordes of demons with his guns, fists, and chainsaw, it becomes evident that DOOM is different from most other modern first-person shooters on home consoles. Subsequent sequels, like Doom Eternal and Doom: The Dark Ages. also have fast-paced and rewarding combat systems, but they are also way more complex. The original 2016 reboot stuck to the basics and, as a result, has the most chaotic but gratifying gameplay in the series.

Devil May Cry 5

The Difficulty Is An Essential Part Of Its Outstanding Combat

Devil May Cry 5
10 /10
14
8.9 /10
Released
March 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

The Devil May Cry franchise is partially responsible for creating and popularizing the hack-and-slash/character action genre, but most of its games are so challenging that most players (especially newcomers) won’t really feel satisfied while playing them. This is one of many reasons why Devil May Cry 5 is often considered the best game in the series, as it is also the most accessible in the series so far.

This game is still hard, but it’s not as punishing as its predecessors, which encourages players to get better at it by mastering its fluid controls and elaborate combos. And when it finally clicks, it becomes evident why Devil May Cry 5 has one of the most polished and satisfying combat systems in the genre. On top of all that, its three playable characters (four in the Special Edition) add some much-needed variety to the gameplay, as each one has their own distinct fighting styles, weapons, and abilities.

One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4

One Of The Best Musou Games Is Based On A Popular Anime/Manga Series

One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4
9.3 /10
Released
March 27, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The Musou genre is perfect for players looking for fast-paced games that give them instant gratification. Classic titles like Dynasty Warriors or Hyrule Warriors allow them to control a powerful character and mow down entire armies of enemies in seconds. While there are a lot of great titles in this genre to choose from, One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 is one of the best and most polished Musou games out there, which is curious considering it’s based on a popular anime/manga series.

The premise is simple but very effective. Players choose a character from this series’ expansive roster, which includes both heroes like the Straw Hat Pirates, and antagonists like the Marine Admirals. They then unleash their bizarre, over-the-top powers to defeat massive armies of random enemies. The controls are smooth, special moves can be activated quickly, and the missions never drag on for too long. To no one's surprise, One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 is incredibly addictive, and longtime One Piece fans should add it to their game collection.

Marvel's Spider-Man 2

Two Powerful Web-Swinging Superheroes For The Price Of One

Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
52
8.9 /10
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

The original Marvel's Spider-Man for PS4 is a masterpiece of the superhero sub-genre. It took everything that made the action in the Batman: Arkham series so great and reworked it to fit Spidey’s unique powers and abilities. After all, who wouldn't want to feel like this iconic web-swinging superhero? The sequel, Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , raised the stakes and improved the gameplay with one simple trick: the addition of not one, but two playable Spider-Men.

Just like its predecessor, the movement in Marvel's Spider-Man 2 is wonderful, and the combat is snappy, fluid, and empowering. But the ability to swap around between Peter Parker and Miles Morales elevates the entire experience. Since the former has the symbiote suit and the latter has his Venom Blast and his invisibility, they both feel very different from each other. Taking down criminals, super-villains, and extraterrestrial threats is always fun, regardless of which one the player is controlling. And, of course, the two-button instant takedowns are always satisfying to pull off and are the perfect way to conclude each battle.

item.title: Hollow Knight: All Whispering Root Locations
item.description:
Of all the NPCs that the Knight will encounter during their quest in Hollow Knight , the Seer is one of the most important. After interacting with the statues in the Resting Grounds, players will be granted the Dream Nail—a special item that allows players to cut through the veil and enter the realm of dreams.

The Dream Nail is used to interact with a variety of things throughout the game, including NPCs to read their innermost thoughts and fight the Dream Warriors. However, something that players may have seen around Hallownest are the odd tree-like growths. These are known as Whispering Roots, and, when struck with the Dream Nail, they expel Essence that can be collected and leave cryptic messages for players to decipher. Essence is used to power up the Dream Nail, and, depending on how much the player has accumulated, earns rewards from the Seer.

There are a total of 15 Whispering Roots that can be found in Hollow Knight . Players can either buy a pin from Iselda to mark their locations on the map (after the Dream Nail has been unlocked), or they can read on to find out exactly where these Whispering Roots can be found.

Updated by Jeff Brooks on October 26, 2025 : This guide has been updated with new images and information to better assist players on their journey throughout Hallownest. Additionally, a new section has been added that details the Seer's rewards in exchange for Essence (collected via the Whispering Roots).

Ancestral Mound Whispering Root Location

The Ancestral Mound is the area that players will be led to after defeating the False Knight. Players will remember that the Shaman Snail locked them inside this area after obtaining the Vengeful Spirit spell, which is used to defeat the Elder Baldur.

There is a side path in the left section of the Ancestral Mound where players can find a large Soul Totem, and above this is a Lifeblood Cocoon that grants temporary masks for the Knight.

Players will need the Monarch Wings to reach the Whispering Root, which is located in the section above the Lifeblood Cocoon.

This Whispering Root tree expels 42 Essence that players will need to collect to complete it. When the player uses the Dream Nail again, they will receive the message:

...Soul attuned...

...Spiral focus...

...Shunned Power...

City of Tears Whispering Root Location

The City of Tears Whispering Root can be found below the City Storerooms Stag Station.

In the large room with multiple suspended platforms, players will find three paths off to the right-hand side of the chamber. The Whispering Root will be found in the bottom-most of these paths, and, after it is struck with the Dream Nail, 28 Essence will scatter into the chamber.

It is advisable to take out all the enemies before collecting the Essence , especially the Lance and Winged Sentries that are patrolling the area, to make the platforming in this area easier.

After using the Dream Nail again on the Whispering Root, players will receive the following message:

...Promised plenty...

...Souls to serve...

...Soul twisted...

Crystal Peak Whispering Root Location

Players will need to have unlocked the Monarch Wings to access the Crystal Peak Whispering Root.

Past the bench where the Crystal Guardian is first encountered, players can travel further up and to the right and make their way to Hallownest’s Crown to the northeast of the Crystal Peak; an important area for the history of the kingdom.

Before making the ascent to Hallownest’s Crown, there is a section that is guarded by Crystallized Husks where players can find the Whispering Root, which will expel 21 Essence for collection. The message that will be revealed after Dream Nailing the tree again will say:

...Light refracted...

...Energy contained...

Deepnest Whispering Root Location

It is easiest to reach the Deepnest Whispering Root from the Queen’s Gardens and dropping down into Deepnest, or by traveling to the Distant Village Stag Station.

Located to the right of the Distant Village, players can find the Whispering Root nestled into a corner behind a Deepling. Players can gain 45 Essence from this tree. When struck with the Dream Nail again, this Whispering Root informs the player:

...Nest alive...

...Sleeping Queen...

...Beast...

Forgotten Crossroads Whispering Root Location

The Mantis Claw is required to reach this Whispering Root, and the Monarch Wings will make things easier on the player (but is not necessary).

Directly opposite the Grubfather’s location, keen-eyed players may spot a crack in the ceiling and a glow emitting from the same area. Using the nail, the Knight can break this section of the wall to open up a secret area. Using the Mantis Claw to scramble up, players will find three Geo deposits in the immediate area, and off to the left is the Whispering Root.

After interacting with it, the tree will release 29 Essence that will spread throughout the chamber with the suspended platforms. Players will need to be careful of the enemies that are scattered throughout this area, and, depending on when they return, the Forgotten Crossroads may look different than they remember . If players decide to use the Dream Nail again, they will be met with this message:

...Twisting paths...

...Travelling masses...

...Vessel Sealed...

Fungal Wastes Whispering Root Location (Near Fog Canyon Shortcut)

To reach the first Fungal Wastes Whispering Root, players will need to have unlocked Isma’s Tear.

Opposite the path that leads to Leg Eater, players will find a small pool of acid that they'll need to swim through to reach the shortcut to Fog Canyon through the Fungal Waste. The Whispering Root will be found in this area, and players can obtain 20 Essence from it. Dream Nailing this Whispering Root again will present players with the following message:

...Misted caverns...

...Noxious spores...

...Teacher...

Fungal Wastes Whispering Root Location (North of Mantis Village)

After players obtain the Mantis Claw from the outskirts of the Mantis Village, they will be able to reach the Whispering Root that is hidden away above. This Whispering Root will grant 18 Essence and the following message when Dream Nailed again:

...Proud warriors...

...Honour bound...

Greenpath Whispering Root Location

Players will need to have unlocked the path between the Queen’s Gardens and Greenpath to reach this Whispering Root.

If they are traveling through Greenpath to reach this Whispering Root, the Mothwing Cloak/Shade Cloak, Isma’s Tear, and Monarch Wings will make the journey much easier as it will require traveling across a large acid pool and pogoing off the back of Durandoos.

Pogoing will also be easier to execute if players have Long Nail or the Mark of Pride charms equipped.

Players can earn 44 Essence from this Whispering Root and this message:

...Greenkin lost...

...Paths overgrown...

...Dream forgotten...

The Hive Whispering Root Location

Players will need the Monarch Wings to enter the Hive.

The fastest way to reach the Hive is to get the tram from either Deepnest or the Ancient Basin and to travel to Kingdom’s Edge. Once the player has arrived in Kingdom’s Edge, they must continue to the right, avoiding the spiky pits, until they reach an area with two small Hivelings buzzing around. These enemies are indicating a secret entrance to the Hive , which can be opened by either attacking with the nail or using a spell to destroy the breakable wall.

To the far right of where the bench is located within the Hive, players can find the Whispering Root that provides 10 Essence . Players should beware of the Hive Soldiers that inhabit the area as their drill attacks are fast and allow them to travel long distances quickly. The strange message that can be received from this Whispering Root reads as:

...Hardened tribe...

...Light familiar...

Howling Cliffs Whispering Root Location

The Mantis Claw is required to reach the Howling Cliffs, and, although players may not necessarily need the Monarch Wings, they are helpful for the platforming sections.

Players should return to the area where the Knight first drops down at the start of the game by using the Mantis Claw to climb back up the large wall to the far left of Dirtmouth. If they take a left in this first chamber, they will find a secret area that they can continue to climb up. Following this path will lead to the Howling Cliffs.

Cornifer can be found at around the halfway point down the cliffs, and the Whispering Root can be found a little further down from his location. Once players use the Dream Nail on it, the Whispering Root will expel 46 Essence and will reveal a message:

...Wasteland...

...Bugs Reduced...

Kingdom's Edge Whispering Root Location

Kingdom’s Edge is an important area in Hollow Knight for players trying to piece together the lore. To reach the Whispering Root in this part of the map, the Monarch Wings will make the platforming here easier to execute, and, potentially, the Primal Aspids easier to dodge.

There are numerous ways for the player to enter Kingdom’s Edge to get to this Whispering Root. Players can descend from the Colosseum of Fools, located to the very north of Kingdom’s Edge, or by going through the secret passage in the King’s Station . This passage can be found by going to the very bottom platform with the two Vengeflies to the far right. If players enter the water and continue swimming to the right, they will find a new area that leads to the Kingdom’s Edge.

For players that have unlocked the Tower of Love , which can also be reached through this passage, there is another exit to Kingdom’s Edge through there that will open up directly opposite their destination. Players will be rewarded with 51 Essence for completing this Whispering Root, and using the Dream Nail again will reveal a message:

...Sacred grave...

...Ashen ground...

...Kingdom's birth...

Queen's Gardens Whispering Root Location

This Whispering Root is located to the far southeast of Queen’s Gardens, directly right from the bench with a viewing window. There are several hazards throughout the Queen’s Gardens, and players are likely to encounter spikes, Mantis Traitors, and temporary platforms as they navigate around the space.

The area with the Whispering Root will require careful platforming, making any mobility upgrades that the Knight can obtain helpful when collecting the 29 Essence from it. This Whispering Root will leave the player with another cryptic message when Dream Nailed again:

...Leaves in splendor...

...Pale root...

Resting Grounds Whispering Root Location

This will likely be the first Whispering Root that players will complete as they will be directed to it after unlocking the Dream Nail. The Seer will inform the Knight that there is a tree that they can collect Essence from ( 20 Essence ), and that it is located just outside of her chamber. The message from this Whispering Root directly references the Seer:

...Dead remembered...

...Penitent Moth...

...Dreams revered...

Royal Waterways Whispering Root Location

Although it is considered part of the Royal Waterways, this Whispering Root can be found in an area between the Royal Waterways and the Ancient Basin .

Players can travel up to the Royal Waterways from the Ancient Basin either by going to the Hidden Station via the Stagways, or by unlocking the tram that travels between Deepnest, the Ancient Basin, and Kingdom’s Edge.

Past the tram station are some platforms that lead up to the Royal Waterways. Players should then go right and travel across the broken pillars (avoiding enemies along the way) until they reach the chamber with the broken elevator. In the far-right corner, players can find a small room with a Whispering Root tucked away that will give them 35 Essence and the following message when Dream Nailed again:

...Kingdom above...

...Palace below...

...Servants' path...

Spirits' Glade Whispering Root Location

Hollow Knight was partially funded by a Kickstarter campaign that had raised over $57,000 (AUD) by the end of 2014. To thank all the fans who had stuck by them and kindly donated money to their project, Team Cherry created the Spirits’ Glade, where backers’ messages have been immortalized within the game .

Spirits’ Glade is found in the Resting Grounds, but it is initially locked behind a door. Players will need to collect 200 Essence and return to the Seer, who will congratulate them on their hard work and unlock the door for them. Inside, players will be greeted by a spirit named Revek who warns players that harming the spirits inside will have severe consequences.

If players prefer to collect Essence in a safer manner, they will find the Whispering Root at the very top right of the Glade where they can earn 34 Essence . The message from this Whispering Root is as follows:

...Sacred memories...

...Honoured souls...

Rewards from the Seer in Exchange for Essence

As stated in the intro, the Seer offers a variety of rewards in exchange for Essence collected throughout Hallownest. These rewards range from Relics and Charms to significant upgrade materials and even achievements for the game.

Reward

Description

Price (Essence)

Hallownest Seal (Relic)

Official seal of the Kingdom of Hallownest, symbolising the authority of the King and his Knights.

100 Essence

Spirits' Glade opens

Unlocks a sub-area of Resting Grounds.

200 Essence

Pale Ore

Rare, pale metal that emanates an icy chill.

Prized by those who craft weapons.

300 Essence

Dream Wielder (Charm)

Allows the bearer to charge the Dream Nail faster and collect more SOUL when striking foes.

500 Essence

Vessel Fragment

Fragment of a white vessel made to contain soul.

Collect more to form a full vessel, allowing you to carry more soul.

700 Essence

Dreamgate (Ability)

Allows the wielder to travel instantly through dream.

900 Essence

Arcane Egg (Relic)

Mysterious stone egg from before the birth of Hallownest.

Relic from the ancient past. This item now holds little value except for those dedicated to history.

1200 Essence

Mask Shard

A shard of an ancient mask, worn to protect oneself from harm.

Collect more to strengthen your shell and protect yourself from damage.

1500 Essence

Awaken the Dream Nail

(Awakening Achievement)

The power of the Dream Nail has fully awoken, allowing entry into certain protected memories.

1800 Essence

Witness the Seer's Ascension

(Ascension Achievement)

Collect 2400 Essence and hear the Seer's final words.

2400 Essence
